page.title: 09Housing around Himbleton
page.content: In total there are about 100 households within the area. About 78% are owner-occupiers , the remainder being rented property. Very few are rented from the local council. As to the buildings themselves very few ( about 7% ) were built between 1914 and 1945 , the remainder split equally between pre-1914 and post-1945. There are about 3 under construction at the present time. There is no mains drainage or gas within the area , all households have electricity , however two still have no mains water. Most houses have central heating (75%) and a telephone (84%) , and all but 8 households have a car _ with virtually no public transport an independent means of transport is essential. About 60% of households grow their own vegitables 10% of which are now self-sufficient.
